snippet: The former chief of the Guinea-Bissau Navy, who was labeled a “drug kingpin” by American officials, faced trafficking charges Monday after a D.E.A. sting.
abstract: Rear Adm Jose Americo Bubo Na Tchuto, former chief of Guinea-Bissau Navy, faces federal drug trafficking charges in New York City after being trapped in elaborate Drug Enforcement Administration sting; operation lays bare some of inner workings of Guinea-Bissau itself, which has long been considered one of world's leading narco-states.
lead_paragraph: The former chief of the Guinea-Bissau Navy, who was labeled a “drug kingpin” by American officials, faced trafficking charges Monday after a D.E.A. sting.

headline.seo: U.S. Sting That Snared Guinea-Bissau Ex-Admiral Shines Light on Drug Trade
headline.main: U.S. Sting That Snared African Ex-Admiral Shines Light on Drug Trade
headline.print_headline: U.S. Sting That Snared African Ex-Admiral Shines a Light on the Drug Trade
